title: AMD Radeon RX 9070 XT
content: The Radeon RX 9070 XT is a graphics card by AMD, expected to launch on January 24, 2025. Built on the 4 nm process and based on the Navi 48 graphics processor (Navi 48 XT variant), the card supports DirectX 12 Ultimate. This ensures that all modern games will run on the Radeon RX 9070 XT. Additionally, the DirectX 12 Ultimate capability guarantees support for hardware-raytracing, variable-rate shading, and more in upcoming video games. It features 4096 shading units, 256 texture mapping units, and 96 ROPs. The card also has 64 raytracing acceleration cores. AMD has paired 16 GB of GDDR6 memory with the Radeon RX 9070 XT, connected using a 256-bit memory interface. The GPU operates at a frequency of 2400 MHz, which can be boosted up to 2970 MHz, with memory running at 2438 MHz (19.5 Gbps effective). Being a dual-slot card, the AMD Radeon RX 9070 XT draws power from 2x 8-pin power connectors, with power draw rated at a maximum of 260 W. Display outputs include 1x HDMI 2.1a and 3x DisplayPort 2.1. The Radeon RX 9070 XT is connected to the rest of the system using a PCI-Express 4.0 x16 interface. The card's dimensions are 267 mm x 111 mm x 50 mm, and it features a dual-slot cooling solution.

title: J.P. Morgan Forecasts Spending on Data Centers Could Boost US GDP by 20 Basis Points in 2025-26
content: J.P. Morgan estimated that spending on data centers could contribute between 10-20 basis points to U.S. economic growth in 2025-2026 as technology companies race to benefit from the artificial intelligence boom. Investments in data centers, which provide computing power for AI, have surged since OpenAI launched ChatGPT in 2022. Companies across sectors increasingly shift their operations to the cloud and integrate AI into their offerings. Mega-cap cloud companies like Microsoft and Alphabet have been heavily investing in AI-related initiatives. The boost to GDP could come primarily through demand for data center construction, technology equipment investment, and additional power generation and transmission infrastructure.

title: Future of PC Tech: 3 Key Trends of 2025
content: With powerful new GPUs, increasingly affordable PCIe Gen 5 SSDs, and budget-friendly motherboard options, the PC landscape is set for a major shift in 2025. NVIDIA’s RTX 50-series and AMD’s RDNA 4 promise game-changing performance leaps, while the arrival of cheaper Gen 5 SSDs marks a new era of high-speed storage. These trends will be bolstered by emerging chipsets from Intel and AMD, ensuring that more users can access advanced features without a premium price tag.

title: Intel Roadmap 2025–2027: All New CPUs to Look Out For
content: 2024 was a challenging year for Intel. The chipmaker lost 60% of its value, the biggest drop in its 53-year history as a public company. However, Intel is preparing a comeback and continuing to build its AI software ecosystem. This roadmap highlights Intel's plans for 2025–2027, including advancements in CPU architecture, collaborations with competitors like AMD, and innovations in AI technologies.

title: AMD to Report Fiscal Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial Results
content: AMD announced that it will report its fiscal fourth quarter and full-year 2024 financial results on February 4, 2025, after the close of the market. Management will conduct a conference call to discuss these results. AMD continues to drive innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies, focusing on pushing the boundaries of what is possible. For more than 50 years, AMD has been a leader in advancing technological performance globally.

title: NVIDIA: A Leading Investment in AI Supercomputing and Telecom Innovation
content: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) has solidified its position as a leader in AI supercomputing and telecom innovation, with significant financial growth attributed to advancements in AI technologies. The company is part of a broader effort by global firms to invest heavily in AI infrastructure and data centers. NVIDIA's role in AI-related projects, coupled with increasing demand for AI-driven solutions, positions it as a key player in shaping the future of technology and economic expansion.
